mapper.select: select s.id, s.period_proceeding as periodProceeding, s.content, s.type, s.repetition_frequency as repetitionFrequency, s.begin_time as beginTime, s.end_time AS endTime, s.period_begin_time as periodBeginTime, s.period_end_time as periodEndTime, s.period_task_num as periodTaskNum, s.task_owner as taskOwner, s.task_owner_id as taskOwnerId, s.frequency_type as frequencyType, s.status, s.source, s.create_date as createDate, s.update_date as updateDate, s.create_person_id as createPersonId, s.create_person_name as createPersonName, s.update_person_id as updatePersonId, s.update_person_name as updatePersonName, s.create_org_id as createOrgId, s.create_org_name as createOrgName, s.create_company_id as createCompanyId, s.create_company_name as createCompanyName, s.concurrency_version as concurrencyVersion, s.delflag as delflag, s.tend_id as tendId from oa_schedule_work_schedule s where s.delflag=0 and (s.task_owner_id=#{userId} and s.create_date like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{date}),'%') or ( unix_timestamp(s.period_begin_time) <unix_timestamp(#{date}) AND unix_timestamp(s.period_end_time) > unix_timestamp(#{date}))) limit #{start},#{limit}

select count(s.id) from oa_schedule_work_schedule s where s.delflag=0 and (s.task_owner_id=#{userId} and s.create_date like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{date}),'%') or ( unix_timestamp(s.period_begin_time) <unix_timestamp(#{date}) AND unix_timestamp(s.period_end_time) > unix_timestamp(#{date})))
